Sentencas: Idaho National Laboratory (INL) is performing high-temperature electrolysis research to generate hydrogen using solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs).
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: The project goals are to address the technical and degradation issues associated with the SOECs.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: This paper provides a summary of various ongoing INL and INL sponsored activities aimed at addressing SOEC degradation.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: These activities include stack testing, post-test examination, degradation modeling, and a list of issues that need to be addressed in future.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Major degradation issues relating to solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) are relatively better understood than those for SOECs.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Some of the degradation mechanisms in SOFCs include contact problems between adjacent cell components, microstructural deterioration (coarsening) of the porous electrodes, and blocking of the reaction sites within the electrodes.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Contact problems include delamination of an electrode from the electrolyte, growth of a poorly (electronically) conducting oxide layer between the metallic interconnect plates and the electrodes, and lack of contact between the interconnect and the electrode.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: INL's test results on high temperature electrolysis (HTE) using solid oxide cells do not provide clear evidence of whether different events lead to similar or drastically different electrochemical degradation mechanisms.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Post-test examination of the solid oxide electrolysis cells showed that the hydrogen electrode and interconnect get partially oxidized and become nonconductive.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: This is most likely caused by the hydrogen stream composition and flow rate during cool down.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: The oxygen electrode side of the stacks seemed to be responsible for the observed degradation due to large areas of electrode delamination.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Based on the oxygen electrode appearance, the degradation of these stacks was largely controlled by the oxygen electrode delamination rate.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Virkar and co-workers have developed a SOEC model based on concepts in local thermodynamic equilibrium in systems otherwise in global thermodynamic nonequilibrium.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: This model is under continued development.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: It shows that electronic conduction through the electrolyte, however small, must be taken into account for determining local oxygen chemical potential, within the electrolyte.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: The chemical potential within the electrolyte may lie out of bounds in relation to values at the electrodes in the electrolyzer mode.
Titulo: Degradation Issues in Solid Oxide Cells During High Temperature Electrolysis

Sentencas: Under certain conditions, high pressures can develop in the electrolyte just under the oxygen electrode (anode)/electrolyte interface, leading to electrode delamination.

Sentencas: This theory is being further refined and tested by introducing some electronic conduction in the electrolyte.
